messages.subject: RE: note from native Dallasite for Ren
messages.msgSnippet: Oh and as for quiet corners to hide in lol.the down town branch of the dallas public library is way cool and quiet in places. I also have a friend who owns a
messages.messageBody:
Oh and as for quiet corners to hide in lol.the down town branch of the
dallas public library is way cool and quiet in places.

I also have a friend who owns a bed and breakfast in downtowm (dallas' only
downtown b&b actually) she would be happy to host you for conversation and
info (www.ameliasplace.com <http://www.ameliasplace.com/> ). I'm sure you
would love her company - very neat lady.



Lots of thrift shopping here in East Dallas, about 15 min from downtown.

geneva



_____

From: Geneva [mailto:gozas@...]
Sent: Thursday, July 12, 2007 9:22 PM
To: 'unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: note from native Dallasite for Ren



Hi.

I have been in Dallas for all of my 32 yrs...You are welcome to contact me
off list for specific info as needed. My family and I currently reside in
East Dallas, near White Rock Lake an area known for its eclectic dining,
shopping and outdoor activities.the Arboretum, the lake itself and a rich
history.

I second the idea of heading to Paper Back's plus, (very close to my area).
I do not know too much about the Irving area other than I don't care for it,
lol.

As for Dallas, there are tons of things to do.Dallas Museum of Art is nice,
the Crow Collection of Asian Art is worth the trip.if you are looking for
night life, I can be more specific and join you lol! We have all types of
shopping and activities as you know.



I'm looking forward to meeting you and will be happy to help you find what
you are looking for.



Geneva

Trying to help my little ones understand how long 6 weeks is



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
